closeCon

public static void closeCon()
TODO: This is an artifact of fixing a really dumb bug. Current Plan: Make a new class that acts like a result and copy in that data. I want the DB connection closed each time since it could be potentially open for days. This would get messy with 100s or 1000s of threads running at a time all with persistent DB connections. Also if the DB went down it wouldn't recover as easily

update

public static boolean update(java.lang.String statement)
Run an SQL update or insert

Parameters:
statement - update or insert string
Returns:
true if successfull, false on error
